question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin also be the nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is indeed selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, despite Larry Elder also being selected. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is not selected. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or changes that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that by July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been taken off any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

Then, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue before July 20 midnight ET. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: In the event that Biden withdraws prior to July 20, will Kamala Harris assume the presidency by July 26?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: President Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Will Vice President Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before 11:59 PM ET on July 26, 2024?

Criteria for condition resolution: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or cannot continue before midnight ET on July 20. Resolves to NO in other cases.
Criteria for outcome resolution: Resolves to YES if Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President before 11:59 PM ET on July 26, 2024. Resolves to NO in other cases.

para_P.title: Should Biden withdraw prior to July 20, will Kamala Harris assume the presidency by July 26?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: President Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Will Vice President Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before 11:59 PM ET on July 26, 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if Biden withdraws or is unable to continue before midnight ET on July 20. Resolves to NO in other cases.
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President before 11:59 PM ET on July 26, 2024. Resolves to NO in other cases.

para_P.body:

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if Biden steps down or is incapacitated before midnight ET on July 20. Resolves to NO in other situations.
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Kamala Harris is acknowledged as President or Acting President before 11:59 PM ET on July 26, 2024. Resolves to NO in other situations.

question.title: Conditional on Biden not dropping out before July 20, will Kamala be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: President Joe Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race past July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, is Vice President Kamala Harris formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race past July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to "Yes" if Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it resolves to "No".

The primary resolution source for this outcome will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden remains in the race until after July 20, will Kamala assume the presidency by Friday?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: President Joe Biden does not withdraw and continues his campaign beyond midnight Eastern Time on July 20. In that case, will Vice President Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

Criteria for assessing the condition: This condition is satisfied if Biden stays in the race and continues after July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for evaluating the outcome: The answer will be "Yes" if Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any moment before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the answer will be "No".

The main source for determining this outcome will be official US government information, along with a consensus from reputable news reporting.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden remains in the race until after July 20, will Kamala become president by Friday?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: President Joe Biden continues his campaign and does not withdraw before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. In that case, will Vice President Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

The main source for determining this outcome will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports.

para_P.body:

Condition for the result: The result is "Yes" if Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not happen, the result is "No".

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.body:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that might occur after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the defined grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even multiple letters that together have a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will conclude NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators push Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most at-risk Democrats have informed local news sources that they’ve already dismissed Biden’s chances for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request that Joe Biden consider terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, but it might also occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals independently informing reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is not sufficient for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft reportedly urges Biden to cease his campaign, as per five individuals knowledgeable about these efforts.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of no fewer than five named Democratic Party House Members or Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter similar to the one mentioned above, or through a group conversation with Biden where they collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five members are part of the same collective communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of Democrats reaching out to Biden to request his withdrawal will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

Should these conditions not be fulfilled before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a group of at least five Democratic House Members or Senators apply pressure on Biden to step down before July 20th?
para_P.body:
As reported by Politico:

Two representatives from secure districts have already made public statements urging Biden to withdraw. Additionally, two of the most at-risk Democrats have suggested to local media that they think Biden's chances of winning in November are low.

The situation is reportedly more urgent behind closed doors. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one draft allegedly recommending that Biden halt his campaign, according to five sources familiar with these discussions.

This market will conclude with a YES if a group of no fewer than five specified Democratic House Members or Senators work together to persuade Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of a signed letter like the one mentioned previously, or through a joint discussion with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is crucial that all five members participate in the same collective communication. If five individuals independently tell reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

Any reports about an unspecified number of Democrats contacting Biden to request his withdrawal will not fulfill the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. In instances where names are mentioned but not confirmed with a high level of certainty, this market will trend towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not met before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given that Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and unambiguous, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Separate individual statements are insufficient. Furthermore, reports must include the names of at least five individuals, confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, before the market's end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO.

If these criteria are not met by July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Individual statements made separately will not suffice. Additionally, reports must identify at least five individuals, verified beyond a reasonable doubt, prior to the market's closing date. In cases of uncertainty, the resolution will lean towards NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

In this context, "broadly accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (potentially requiring a subscription). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or restricted for certain groups (like minors), it will still count as a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

Here, "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still count positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not available in some EU nations (as it was in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be deemed a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to enter queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will the public in the European Union have access to OpenAI's ChatGPT by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **YES** response if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available for public use in the EU on June 30, 2024, and a **NO** if it is not.

"Available for public use" indicates that the typical scenario for individuals in the EU allows them to access it without utilizing a VPN (although it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for specific demographics (such as minors), it will still be regarded as a favorable outcome, provided that more than half of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" specifically refers to the primary web platform (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be classified as a favorable outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service fundamentally remains the same (permitting users to submit inquiries into systems based on Large Language Models).

Details for P: The associated market will resolve to YES if it has at least 377 participants before the market closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

Details for Q: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" means available to over 50% of the population without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves to YES if it is unavailable in certain countries or to minors, and if the service remains largely unchanged even if the name or website is different.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves as YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in the position of President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed a YES if Biden continues to hold the office of President of the United States at the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not constitute a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is separate from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from participating in the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion editorials, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring is confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or trustworthy news outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for resolution.

The question will be answered "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent developments that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office on the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, leading to him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024. It resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified from participating in a primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to hold the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, personal opinions, or unofficial statements do not count as valid confirmation. The inquiry specifically focuses on whether Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot but is later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15 he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, then the condition is not satisfied.

In that case, can we confirm that Biden will remain the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This question will yield a YES if Biden is still President at the end of July 2024. It will yield a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a NO answer, as the role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is prohibited from participating in a primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to be President until July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following situation: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media coverage. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements are insufficient for this determination. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is initially removed or blocked from a ballot but then reinstated such that he is not blocked as of July 15th, the condition is not satisfied.

In that case, is it accurate to say that Biden will remain the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET)? This would be a YES if Biden is still in office at the end of July 2024. It would be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (making his Vice President the Acting President) does not result in a NO answer, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump be disqualified from taking part in a primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain in office as President until July 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments do not count for this conclusion. The question specifically addresses whether Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the given circumstances by July 15, 2024. If Trump is initially barred from a ballot but then allowed to run again so that he is not barred as of July 15th, the condition is not met.

In this situation, can we assert that Biden will still be the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET)? This would be a YES if Biden continues to hold office at the end of July 2024. It would be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date. A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment (where his Vice President acts as President) does not lead to a NO answer, since the Acting President is not considered the same as the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed by the lack of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal or block.

Then is it true that Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through that time, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump is not prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is verified by the absence of formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources reporting any such barring or removal.

In that case, can we say that Biden will still hold the office of President of the United States through the end of July 2024 (ET)? The answer is YES if Biden remains in office during that period, and NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before then. A temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment does not change this outcome.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump is not disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or prevented from being listed on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is established by the absence of official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal records, or trustworthy media reports that would indicate such disqualification or prevention.

Given this, can we affirm that Biden will stay in the position of U.S. President until the end of July 2024 (ET)? The answer is YES if Biden is still President at that point, and NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th Amendment does not influence this conclusion.

para_P.title: Provided that Donald Trump is neither disqualified nor barred from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden maintain his role as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s examine the following situation: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or obstructed from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed by the lack of official declarations from state authorities, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible news sources that would suggest such disqualification or obstruction.

In light of this, can we conclude that Biden will remain in the role of U.S. President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? The response is YES if Biden is still in office at that time, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not affect this determination.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the advantage that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this query.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the national polling average by 538 on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but less than 3?
para_P.body:
This question pertains to the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies Trump's lead, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, a value of 2.4 on July 5, 2024, means Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points, thus representing a positive figure of 2.4 for this analysis.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given the Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question examines the potential impact of the Republican Party losing Ohio's 6th congressional district on Liz Cheney's chances of becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a "No" if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden as per the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. Should Biden and Trump have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the numbers shown by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Any adjustments in the method FiveThirtyEight uses to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

This inquiry examines how the allocation of gold medals in women's team sports relates to individual swimming accomplishments at the 2024 Olympics.

Let's consider the premise: No country wins more than one gold medal in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics. This indicates that women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) earn gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

In light of this situation, will a swimmer claim the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Games? This concludes as **Yes** if the competitor with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.

para_P.title: Assuming no country secures more than one gold in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, is it possible for a swimmer to achieve the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the allocation of gold medals in women's team sports and the accomplishments of individual swimmers at the 2024 Olympics.

Let us consider the premise: No country wins more than one gold in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics. This implies that women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

In light of this situation, is it feasible for a swimmer to win the greatest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This concludes as **Yes** if the competitor with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in the swimming events.

para_P.title: If no nation wins more than one gold medal in women's team events at the 2024 Olympics, can a swimmer secure the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between the distribution of gold medals in women's team events and the achievements of individual swimmers at the upcoming 2024 Olympics.

We start with the assumption: No nation is awarded more than one gold medal in women's team events at the 2024 Olympics. This means that women's teams from eight separate National Olympic Committees (NOC) will each take home gold in the eight team events: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Given these conditions, is it possible for a swimmer to attain the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This is affirmed as **Yes** if the individual with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics competes in swimming.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news outlets that they have given up on Biden's chances for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will be resolved as YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

It is necessary for all five individuals to be part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden with requests for him to step aside will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Georgia fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Czechia qualify?
question.body:
This conditional question explores the relationship between the qualification outcomes of Georgia and Czechia in Eurovision 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Czechia participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition (Georgia failing to qualify) resolves as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced as having qualified for the Grand Final. For any other outcome, it resolves as **No**.
- The outcome (Czechia qualifying) resolves as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

- The outcome (Czechia qualifying) is deemed **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, it is considered **No**.

If the condition is unmet, the question will resolve as N/A.

question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will five or more identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have communicated to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. There are various drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these letters would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these discussions.

This market will conclude with a YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators jointly ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through a letter similar to what has been reported, or through another means such as a group meeting with Biden and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is necessary that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden requesting him to step down will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will result in a NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one is expected to request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive number denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation in which Poland fails to reach the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. 

Criteria for determining Poland's status: Resolves Yes if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves No if Poland qualifies. 

Criteria for determining Portugal's status: Resolves Yes if Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves No if Portugal does not qualify. 

The inquiry seeks to find out if Portugal will qualify for the Grand Final, based on the condition that Poland does not.

para_P.title: Should Poland fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Portugal succeed in doing so?
para_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Poland does not make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. 

To determine Poland's outcome: It is a Yes if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It is a No if Poland qualifies. 

To determine Portugal's outcome: It is a Yes if Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It is a No if Portugal does not qualify. 

The question aims to ascertain whether Portugal will qualify for the Grand Final, given that Poland does not.
