question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing behind Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas every other Democrat assessed in these hypotheticals is either ahead or within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which end on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a speculative ballot, while the other requests votes alongside a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the error margin, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in hypothetical scenarios either leads or stays within the error margin. Are the views of Manifold participants reflective of the broader public? 

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for the first poll minus the formula for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A and will stay open until the closing time, regardless of circumstances.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for another term.

The resolution will be Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention delegates, and No otherwise. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election itself.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might take place after the specified date. It specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially announce that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and enable the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.body:
This is resolved with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not count. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is it possible for Scotland to conduct an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to possess any legal binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum where permission for the vote has been denied by the UK government, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. It is essential that the referendum has the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Will there be an officially authorized referendum on Scotland's independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if an official referendum takes place in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum occurs before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; thus, it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has not granted permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society organizations. An official referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of an officially sanctioned vote regarding Scotland's independence occurring before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if a sanctioned vote regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom is held, and this vote takes place prior to May 3, 2024. The vote may be categorized as an "advisory" referendum; therefore, it is not necessary for it to have any legal enforcement.

A vote will not be deemed valid if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum, where the UK government has not authorized the ballot, nor if it is conducted by civic organizations. An official vote must be acknowledged as having the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be unequivocal and conclusive: it should remove any chance that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle.

If such an unambiguous announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome will still be positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report the event no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden formally announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a credible news organization report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered TRUE if a major and trustworthy news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be deemed adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden opts to step down, will a reputable news source disclose this at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be regarded as TRUE if a significant and reliable news organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post announces the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal declaration concerning the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news agencies, conspiracy theory websites, or remarks by individual users on Manifold will not be considered sufficient.

This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.body:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a better probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same FiveThirtyEight forecast. Should both candidates have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be determined using FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's forecasting methods will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data becomes available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden as per the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are seen as having equal chances, this market will resolve at a 50-50 split.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may not be resolved until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please keep in mind that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will NOT be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight show Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is determined to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. On the other hand, it will resolve to "No" if Donald Trump is found to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. If Biden and Trump are perceived as having equal probabilities, this market will resolve at a 50-50 division.

The resolution will depend on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the data indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology for calculating its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as the information for July 20 is published. It is possible that this market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data becomes available. If the data for July 19 is not obtainable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding data to July 19.

Please note that the resolution relates to the winning probabilities for each candidate expressed as a score out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for instance, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will NOT be considered.

This is based on the odds indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically for July 19, and will be resolved as soon as data for July 20 becomes available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that Francis Suarez will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Suarez is selected as the nominee, and NO if any other candidate is selected. This decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is needed, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as shown on the New York Times interactive election page. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: Resolves YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, resolves NO.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: By midnight July 20 Central Time, if 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw, as indicated on the New York Times interactive election page. In that case, will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Criteria for resolution:
- Condition: Resolves to YES if at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are urging Biden to step down. If not, it resolves to NO.
- Outcome: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. It resolves to NO if only a single ballot is necessary.

para_P.title: If 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before midnight on July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw, as indicated on the New York Times interactive election page. Will the Democratic Party necessitate multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Criteria for resolution:
- Condition: Resolves to YES if at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page displays 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to withdraw. Otherwise, resolves to NO.
- Outcome: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves to NO if only a single ballot is needed.

para_P.title: Should 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden's withdrawal prior to July 20, will the Democrats hold a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Given the following scenario: By midnight on July 20 Central Time, if 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden to step down, as reported on the New York Times interactive election page. Will the Democratic Party require several rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Criteria for resolution:
- Condition: Resolves to YES if at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page shows 10 or more Democratic Senators requesting Biden's withdrawal. Otherwise, resolves to NO.
- Outcome: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves to NO if only a single ballot is sufficient.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. This is determined by the New York Times tracking page, which resolves as 'Yes' if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question resolves as 'Yes' if more than one round of voting is needed, indicating a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as 'No'.

para_P.title: Given that less than 10 Democratic Senators request Biden to resign prior to July 20, will there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to step down before July 20, 2024. This is verified by the New York Times tracking page, which concludes as 'Yes' if at no time before midnight July 20 Central Time, it indicates 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to withdraw.

In that case, will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question will resolve as 'Yes' if more than one voting round is necessary, signifying a brokered convention. If only a single ballot is required, then this question will resolve as 'No'.

para_P.title: If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20, 2024. This is verified by the New York Times tracking page, which concludes as 'Yes' if it never shows 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to resign at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time.

In that case, will the Democratic Party need to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as 'Yes' if multiple rounds of voting are necessary, suggesting a brokered convention. Conversely, if only a single ballot is sufficient, then it resolves as 'No'.

para_P.title: Should fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden's resignation before July 20, will the Democrats have to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Given the following scenario: If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators request Biden to step down prior to July 20, 2024, as confirmed by the New York Times tracking page, which indicates 'Yes' if it never records 10 or more Democratic Senators advocating for Biden's resignation at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time.

In this scenario, will the Democratic Party have to carry out more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to formally select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This will be answered with 'Yes' if multiple voting rounds are required, indicating a brokered convention; if just one ballot suffices, the answer will be 'No'.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle.

To achieve a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be considered No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's administration of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the United States government terminate its agreement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com top-level domain prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or abolishes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). Conversely, if this does not occur, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States government to cancel its contract allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com top-level domain before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or nullifies its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that grants Verisign the authority over the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024. If this does not happen, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the US government ending its agreement with Verisign for .com management by August 3, 2024, will Joe Biden announce by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the US Department of Commerce ends the agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024. Resolves No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. Resolves No if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

question.title: Conditional on the US government continuing its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management on or after August 3, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two events:

1. **Condition**: The US government continues its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, on or after August 3, 2024. This resolves as Yes if on or after August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) has not officially terminated or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does happen before August 3, 2024, this question resolves as No.

2. **Outcome**: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this resolves as No.

Suppose the following is true: The US government continues its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD management on or after August 3, 2024. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.body: This inquiry concludes as **Yes** if the total count of world records established during the Paris Olympics meets or exceeds 24.

para_P.title: Are there going to be 24 or more world records set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the total number of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds that number.

para_P.title: Will 24 or more world records be established at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a response of **Yes** if the overall count of world records achieved at the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will have a positive resolution if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties also result in a positive resolution) at the Olympic Games taking place in 2024. It will remain uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total number of medals earned by each participating nation, arranged by:

1. Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Count of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will France secure a position among the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a positive outcome if France secures a place in the top 5 (ties will also yield a positive outcome) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be considered ambiguous if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the total number of medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. The Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) The Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) The Count of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for France to finish in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will receive an affirmative answer if France manages to place within the top 5 (including ties) during the upcoming Olympics in 2024. If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the outcome will be deemed uncertain.

The rankings for medals are established by counting the total medals won by each country and arranging them according to:

1. The Number of Gold Medals
2. (In the event of a tie in 1) The Number of Silver Medals
3. (In the event of a tie in 2) The Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Given France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between France's performance and the breaking of world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Suppose the following is true: France places in the top 5 at the Olympics being held in 2024, with the medal table calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze Medals won. Resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the Paris Olympics? This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: If France secures a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be a minimum of 24 world records shattered?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between France's achievements and the establishment of new world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Assuming the following holds true: France finishes in the top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, with the medal standings determined by the total count of Gold, Silver, and Bronze Medals achieved. The question remains unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

Consequently, will there be at least 24 world records set during the Paris Olympics? This question is answered with **Yes** if the count of world records set during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Let us consider the following scenario: Prior to June 1, 2024, there are no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China. This implies that:

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomats representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats who are in the PRC.
- The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.
- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats based in the Philippines.

Given this situation, is it accurate to say that before August 1, 2024, at least one of the following actions will occur:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the PRC.
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats working in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats in the Philippines?

Resolution criteria: The response is Yes if any of the aforementioned actions take place between June 1, 2024, and August 1, 2024. If none of these actions occur before August 1, 2024, the response is No.

para_P.title: Provided that there are no diplomatic expulsions or recalls occurring between China and the Philippines before June 1, 2024, will any such events transpire prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s examine this scenario: Before June 1, 2024, there are no diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving China and the Philippines. This means that:

- The Philippines does not send away any diplomats from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines does not call back any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC does not send away any diplomats from the Philippines.
- The PRC does not call back any of its diplomats who are in the Philippines.

Under these circumstances, can we affirm that before August 1, 2024, at least one of the following actions will take place:

- The Philippines sends away at least one diplomat from the PRC.
- The Philippines calls back at least one of its diplomats working in the PRC.
- The PRC sends away at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC calls back at least one of its diplomats in the Philippines?

Resolution criteria: The answer is Yes if any of the aforementioned actions occur between June 1, 2024, and August 1, 2024. If none of these actions happen before August 1, 2024, the answer is No.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible within the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without employing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in some EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (although it may require payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be available to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The response will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) can be used by the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it cannot.

"Available to the public" signifies that individuals in the EU can utilize it without the need for a VPN (though payment may be necessary). If it is not available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for particular groups (such as minors), it will still be deemed a favorable outcome, provided that more than half of the population has access.

"ChatGPT" pertains to the primary web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. A favorable outcome will still be acknowledged even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service continues to operate fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report on external red-teaming by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it, even if unavailable in certain countries or to specific groups like minors. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

para_P.title: With the general availability of ChatGPT in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report on external red-teaming by that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is to access it without needing a VPN, potentially requiring payment, and that over 50% of the population can utilize it, even if it is not available in some countries or for certain groups such as minors. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the overall web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it is considered positively if the service remains largely unchanged, despite any alterations in name or website.

Thus, is it accurate to say that Google DeepMind will issue a public report detailing the findings from an external party assessing the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

para_P.title: With the expectation that ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report on external red-teaming by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union starting June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, potentially involving a fee, and at least more than 50% of the population has access, even if it is not available in certain nations or to specific demographics like minors. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it will be considered positively if the service remains largely unchanged, regardless of any name or website alterations.

Then, can it be said that Google DeepMind will issue a public report detailing the findings from an external entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

para_P.title: Given that ChatGPT is anticipated to be broadly available in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report on external red-teaming by that same date?
para_P.body:
If we accept the premise that OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union from June 30, 2024, where "broadly available" means that individuals in the EU can utilize it without the need for a VPN, possibly for a fee, and at least half of the population has access, despite it not being accessible in some countries or to certain groups such as minors. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the overall web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it will be viewed favorably if the service remains mostly the same, regardless of any changes in name or website.

Then, is it reasonable to conclude that Google DeepMind will release a public report outlining the results from an external assessment of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT not being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report with external red-teaming results by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: If OpenAI's ChatGPT is not broadly accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report detailing external red-teaming findings by that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following condition holds: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not broadly accessible to individuals in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not broadly accessible" indicates that the typical situation for people in the EU is that they cannot utilize it without a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is inaccessible in specific EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to, for instance, minors, this will be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population cannot access it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

Thus, is it accurate to say that Google DeepMind will issue a report containing outcomes from external red-teaming of their models concerning safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question is answered with YES if, by June 30, 2024, they release a public report with the findings from an external entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: If OpenAI's ChatGPT is not widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report detailing external red-teaming findings by that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not widely accessible within the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they cannot utilize it without a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is inaccessible in specific EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to (for instance) minors, this will be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the populace cannot access it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

Thus, is it accurate that Google DeepMind will issue a report containing results from external red-teaming of their models concerning safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered a YES if, by June 30, 2024, they make a public report available detailing the findings from an external entity that red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Should OpenAI's ChatGPT remain largely unavailable in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report outlining external red-teaming results by that date?
para_P.body:
Given the following scenario: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not largely available across the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not largely available" means that the typical situation for people in the EU is that they cannot use it without a VPN (which may incur a cost). If it is unavailable in certain EU countries (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is inaccessible to (for example) minors, this will be deemed a favorable outcome, as long as over 50% of the population cannot access it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It still counts positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

Therefore, is it true that Google DeepMind will release a report featuring findings from external red-teaming of their models regarding safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered a YES if, by June 30, 2024, they provide a public report detailing the outcomes from an external organization that red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models.
