question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the advantage Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will the lead that Trump holds over Biden in the national polling average from 538 on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but less than 3?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the differential favoring Donald Trump over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive outcome signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative outcome indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading by 2.4 points, this would mean a positive outcome of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera for over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden engages in another such face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, the outcome will be a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video could potentially only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each included less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The market resolves YES if such an interview occurs before the end of July 2024, and NO if no qualifying interview is released by then.

Given this condition, the question is whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for that date. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden have a face-to-face interview captured on video lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but be 3 or less on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?

question.title: If Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition is not met. The condition excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Given this condition, will Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to participate in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting more than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming Joe Biden does not engage in an in-person interview or discussion on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The last relevant interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. If Biden takes part in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition will not be satisfied. The stipulation excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It does include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person.

Given this stipulation, will Trump's margin over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming Joe Biden does not partake in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The latest qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. If Biden takes part in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this condition will not be fulfilled. The stipulation excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that has been edited into a program like 60 Minutes, but there must be no less than 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person.

Given this stipulation, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This inquiry will be resolved based on the margin by which Donald Trump leads Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden does not participate in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion lasting more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 but not more than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming Joe Biden refrains from engaging in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for at least 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. The last qualifying interview was Biden's guest appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for around 70 minutes. Should Biden participate in another such in-person interview of at least 45 minutes, this condition will not be met. This requirement excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that has been edited into a program like 60 Minutes, but there must be no less than 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person.

Given this requirement, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This question will be answered based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure shows Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date indicates Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the Opening Ceremony date (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony date (11 August 2024). The response will be negative if the aforementioned scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers of France.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the inquiry will be considered negative if the aforementioned does not occur.

An occurrence will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental body of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Will there be an anticipated terrorist event in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered in the affirmative if a terrorist event in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) leads to injuries or deaths of at least one person, not including the terrorist(s), from the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). On the other hand, the question will be marked negative if the aforementioned does not take place.

An event will be classified as a 'terrorist event' if it is designated as such by any governmental authority of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Malta reach the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be marked as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is later verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as eligible for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If they do not qualify, the result will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight classify Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. In the event that both candidates are viewed as equally likely to win, the market will split 50-50.

The resolution will be determined using FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the method by which FiveThirtyEight derives its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is made available. It is possible that this market may not resolve until the datapoints for July 20 are accessible. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: FiveThirtyEight projects Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump on July 19, 2024. This is determined by the FiveThirtyEight election forecast numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this is considered a 50-50 resolution. The resolution is based on the July 19 data as soon as July 20 data becomes available, or the nearest previous data if July 19 data is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

Given this scenario, will Tim Scott be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on election day.

The determination is based on the data from July 19, and will be updated as soon as data from July 20 is available, or the closest prior data if July 19 information is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

In light of this situation, will Tim Scott be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The conclusion is reliant on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on election day.

question.title: If 538 projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

Then, is it true that Tim Scott will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: This resolves to “Yes” if Trump is projected as the favorite on July 19, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. If Biden is projected as the favorite, it resolves to “No”. If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50.

Resolution criteria for Q: This resolves to “Yes” if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Otherwise, it resolves to “No.”

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or through a virtual platform, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the purported "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 but not more than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

In this scenario, a positive number signifies Trump's lead, while a negative number indicates Biden's lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

Next, is it accurate that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This question will be resolved based on the value indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: If the Greens–EFA group secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for any other scenario. In cases where two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution of this question will be based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

Then, is it accurate that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024? This question will be resolved based on the figure reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Should the Greens–EFA group attain the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Provided that the following is accurate: The Greens–EFA political group achieves the highest seat count post the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will yield a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group secures the most seats after the 2024 elections, and a **No** in all other circumstances. If two groups have the same number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with a **Yes**. The determination of this question will rely on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media sources.

Thus, is it true that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024? This question will be resolved based on the figure displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive number signifies a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden lead. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Given Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be determined based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports, and if two groups are tied for seats, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading.

para_P.title: If the Greens–EFA group does not have the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Donald Trump be ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 but not exceeding 3 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: The Greens–EFA political alliance does not possess the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be established through official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable news sources, and if two parties are tied in seats, this criterion is not satisfied.

Then, is it accurate that Donald Trump will have a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead.

para_P.title: If the Greens–EFA does not secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 and at most 3 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Greens–EFA political faction does not possess the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as verified by official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources, and in case of a tie between two groups for seats, this scenario is considered unmet.

Then, can it be confirmed that Donald Trump will have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not surpass 3 in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead.

para_P.title: Should the Greens–EFA fail to obtain the majority of seats in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and at most 3 based on 538's national polling average as of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Given the following conditions: The Greens–EFA political group does not achieve the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as confirmed by official statements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media outlets, and in the event of a tie between two parties for seats, this situation is regarded as not fulfilled.

Then, is it possible to affirm that Donald Trump will have a margin over Joe Biden that is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the graph for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive value indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative value indicates a lead for Biden.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Chris Christie being the Republican nominee, will Tim Scott also be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Chris Christie is indeed selected, we then ask whether Tim Scott will also be selected as the nominee by the same convention.

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if both Chris Christie and Tim Scott are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It resolves as **No** if Chris Christie is selected but Tim Scott is not. If Chris Christie is not selected, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Chris Christie is the Republican candidate, will Tim Scott also be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This inquiry examines the situation in which Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Chris Christie is indeed chosen, we then inquire whether Tim Scott will also be chosen as the candidate by the same convention.

Resolution criteria: The inquiry is resolved as **Yes** if both Chris Christie and Tim Scott receive nominations from the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is resolved as **No** if Chris Christie is nominated but Tim Scott is not. If Chris Christie does not receive the nomination, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated before August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. does not apply. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not included.

para_P.title: Will Section 4 of the 25th Amendment be invoked to declare Biden unable to perform his duties before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with a YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and responsibilities of his office" and designates the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not relevant. Biden's own use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is excluded.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

To achieve a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a public declaration from Joe Biden prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any chance that Biden could accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a decisive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Should Biden state that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement is unequivocal and final, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

Then, is it accurate to say that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially proclaim that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is not applicable.

para_P.title: Should Biden declare that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. This announcement is unequivocal and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to the nomination.

In that case, is it accurate to say that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

para_P.title: If Biden announces he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will he be considered incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and public official announcement stating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election. This statement is definitive and removes any chance of Biden consenting to the nomination.

In this situation, is it correct to assert that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the duties and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to assume the role of President?

Note: The duration of the incapacity is not relevant for this question. Scenarios involving Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., are not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is no unambiguous and conclusive statement leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not provide a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This implies that there is no clear and definitive announcement, leaving open the possibility that Biden might still accept the nomination.

In that case, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The length of the incapacity is not relevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to publicly declare his intention not to accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will he be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not provide a clear, public, official statement by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This implies that there is no unequivocal and definitive declaration, leaving open the possibility that Biden might still accept the nomination.

In that case, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) enact Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is not applicable.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden does not issue a public announcement stating he will not seek the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will he be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Joe Biden fails to make a clear, public, official announcement by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not seek and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This indicates the absence of an unequivocal and definitive statement, leaving the door open for the possibility that Biden may still decide to accept the nomination.

In this scenario, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry. Situations such as Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., are not considered. Biden's use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not relevant.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official coalition or electoral partnership is declared between Les Républicains and the National Rally prior to June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). Conversely, if no such partnership is made public, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the French Republicans (Les Républicains) establish a coalition with the National Rally for the legislative elections in 2024?

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to rapidly nominate Biden?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, claiming it suppresses the ongoing critical discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, revealing that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, create unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Even if multiple letters collectively have 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market closing time, this market will resolve to NO.

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration by July 15, 2024, stating that he will refuse the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden publicly announce by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?
para_P.body:
This question will be marked as **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a definitive and official public announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:

This occurs if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure denotes a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?

This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, translating to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the measurement of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump was 2.4 points in front of Biden, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Tim Scott being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not the day of the 2024 US election itself. 

Given this condition, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of performing the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to carry out the responsibilities and functions of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not applicable. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be activated to determine Biden's incapacity before August?
para_P.body:
This query receives a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the duties and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not relevant. Additionally, Biden's own use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican lawmaker has urged Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 consider Biden the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden on that same date. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be determined by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology for calculating these figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If the July 19 data is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Should both candidates have identical probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is made available. It is possible that this market will not resolve until the data for July 20 is accessible. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the closest preceding data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a value out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.
