This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is evaluated to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is considered to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If both candidates are assessed to have equal probabilities, the market will settle at 50-50.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically looking at the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the designated resolution date. Any changes in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to generate its data will not influence the outcome of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 becomes available. It is possible that this market will remain unresolved until the data for July 20 is accessible. If the data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest preceding data to July 19.

It is crucial to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a value out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be considered.

question.title: Given FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024. This means that Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thus causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President? This does not include Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter for this question.

para_P.title: With FiveThirtyEight indicating Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, will he be declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:

This suggests that Biden has a greater likelihood of winning compared to Trump based on FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If there are no figures available for July 19, the closest preceding data will be utilized.

Then, is it accurate to state that before August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office," thereby allowing the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President? This does not encompass Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

This scenario excludes Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

This situation does not consider Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or the application of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys repeatedly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically is either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the broader public's views?

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump outpaces Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling figures between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden's advantage. For instance, the reported value on July 5, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, and evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number denotes a Trump advantage, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, if the value on July 5, 2024, shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, that would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

para_P.title: If the Democrats are compelled to hold a brokered convention in 2024, will Trump have a lead over Biden ranging from 2 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
In the event that the Democratic Party must undergo several rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to formally select its candidate for the 2024 presidential election, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, as reflected in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, be greater than 2 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024?

Condition for fulfillment: This condition is deemed satisfied if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Criteria for outcome determination: The result is classified as YES if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election surpasses 2 and is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as indicated in the chart for that date when verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Given Democrats avoid a brokered convention in 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, is Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves as **No** if more than one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for that date. In the event that both candidates are assigned equal probabilities, the market will resolve 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight employs to calculate its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is obtained. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the odds of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but be 4 or less, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by assessing the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as presented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number signifies a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden advantage. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the value reported by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true? On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Trump is favored, it resolves to “No.” If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50. The resolution is based on the odds reported by FiveThirtyEight, ignoring any changes in methodology.

para_P.title: Considering that Trump has a lead of 2 to 4 points over Biden on July 15, 2024, will Biden be viewed as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, according to 538?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 and up to 4 points as per 538's national polling average. 

Criteria for evaluating this situation: This is determined by the value reported by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value signifies a lead for Trump.

Next, is it accurate to say that on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is anticipated to be the leading candidate for the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's election predictions? 

Criteria for the result: This will be considered “Yes” if Joe Biden's chances of winning exceed those of Donald Trump based on FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. If Trump is considered more likely to win, it will be “No.” If both candidates have equal chances, it will be treated as 50-50. The resolution relies on the odds provided by FiveThirtyEight, disregarding any methodological changes.

Now, is it correct to state the following? On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted to be the leading candidate for the US presidential election as per FiveThirtyEight's election prediction.

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Trump is projected to win, it will be “No.” If the probabilities are equal, it will be resolved as 50-50. The resolution is based on the probabilities reported by FiveThirtyEight, disregarding any methodological changes.

Now, can we affirm the following? On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is anticipated to be the leading candidate for the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast.

Criteria for determining the result: This will be marked as “Yes” if Joe Biden is expected to have a higher chance of winning compared to Donald Trump based on FiveThirtyEight's election prediction for July 19, 2024. If Trump is expected to win, it will be marked as “No.” If the chances are equal, it will be classified as 50-50. The resolution will rely on the probabilities provided by FiveThirtyEight, ignoring any changes in methodology.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead of either 2 points or fewer, or more than 4 points over Joe Biden in the national polling average reported by 538. For this inquiry, a positive figure denotes a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's national polling average by either 2 points or less, or by more than 4 points, as shown in the chart for that day. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure implies Biden is in the lead.

On July 19, 2024, will Joe Biden be forecasted to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election model? para_P.body:
If it is true that on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in the national polling average by either 2 points or fewer, or by more than 4 points, as illustrated in that day's chart. Here, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will settle on "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will settle on "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons storage facility on Israeli territory, the market will settle on "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyberattacks, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for the resolution of this market. Attacks against Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah or the Houthis) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action before 11:59 PM Eastern Time on August 12th?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Iran conducts military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such actions occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

For this market, any form of military engagement by Iran on Israeli land, air, or sea (for example, if an Iranian missile strikes an Israeli weapons facility, the market will reflect a "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or supported by reliable reports will be considered. This encompasses various forms of military actions, including airstrikes, naval engagements, or ground assaults. However, cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not influence the outcome of this market.

Only actions attributed to Iranian forces that are officially stated by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have been launched from Iranian territory, will be factored into the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah or the Houthis) will not be included in this market's resolution.

para_P.title: Will Iran engage in military operations prior to 11:59 PM Eastern Time on August 12th?
para_P.body:
This market will yield a "Yes" result if Iran undertakes military actions on Israeli land, airspace, or waters from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If such actions do not happen, the market will result in a "No".

For this market, any type of military action by Iran on Israeli territory (for instance, if an Iranian missile hits an Israeli munitions site, the market will indicate a "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by Iranian officials or corroborated by credible reports will be taken into account. This includes various military activities, such as airstrikes, naval confrontations, or ground offensives. However, cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic efforts will not affect the outcome of this market.

Only actions attributed to Iranian military forces that are officially announced by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, will be included in the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel executed by proxy organizations (like Hezbollah or the Houthis) will not be considered in this market's outcome.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Suppose the following is true: The linked market has fewer than 377 traders by the end of July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. This resolves YES if the market embedded above has fewer than 377 traders before market close. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there any possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or taken off the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the removal or barring must come from official announcements by state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for the resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It exclusively relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will be answered "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority Representation from Hungary in the 2024 Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the European Parliament elections in 2024, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with a "Yes" if, following the European Parliament elections in 2024, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby retaining the highest proportion of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.

para_P.title: Is the European Union expected to declare new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Are new tariffs or duties anticipated from the European Union on the import of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has declared the introduction of new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU prior to July 5, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

para_P.title: If the EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China, will Fidesz-KDNP keep its lead in Hungarian representation in the EU in 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming that credible reports indicate the European Union (EU) has imposed new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtain a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition after the 2024 European Parliament elections, thus preserving the most significant representation of Hungary in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources?

para_P.title: If the EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China, will Fidesz-KDNP keep its majority representation from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming this scenario: Prior to July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has imposed new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. After the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtain more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on trustworthy sources?

para_P.title: Should the EU impose new tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its majority representation for Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: In the following situation: Before July 5, 2024, credible information suggests that the European Union (EU) has enacted new tariffs or duties on the importation of electric vehicles from China. Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP coalition secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby ensuring the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to reliable sources?

question.title: Conditional on the EU not announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union does not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This means there are no credible reports of such announcements. Then, is it true that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its plurality in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

para_P.title: If the EU refrains from introducing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP continue to hold the most seats from Hungary in the European Parliament in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The European Union does not implement any new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024. This implies that there are no reliable reports regarding such announcements. In that case, can we assert that Fidesz-KDNP will preserve its majority representation in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
- Regarding the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no reliable reports of the EU imposing new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles.
- Regarding the outcome: Resolves Yes if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thereby retaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament as per credible sources.

para_P.title: Assuming the EU refrains from introducing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP retain its majority representation from Hungary in the 2024 European Parliament?
para_P.body:
Let us assume the following holds true: The European Union does not impose any new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024. This indicates that there are no reliable announcements regarding such tariffs. Under these circumstances, can we conclude that Fidesz-KDNP will keep its majority representation in the European Parliament from Hungary after the 2024 elections?

Criteria for resolution:
- Regarding the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- Regarding the outcome: Resolves Yes if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thereby ensuring the largest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament as confirmed by reliable sources.

para_P.title: If the EU does not impose additional tariffs on electric vehicles from China, will Fidesz-KDNP continue to hold the majority of Hungarian seats in the 2024 European Parliament?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: The European Union does not implement any new tariffs or fees on the import of electric vehicles from China before July 5, 2024. This suggests that there are no trustworthy announcements regarding such tariffs. Given this situation, can we determine that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its majority representation in the European Parliament from Hungary after the elections in 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
- Concerning the condition: Resolves Yes if, prior to July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that the EU has declared new tariffs or fees on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles.
- Concerning the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after the elections for the European Parliament in 2024, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus ensuring the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament as verified by reliable sources.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: Will Poland reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. On the other hand, if Poland does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Denmark set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Will Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. On the other hand, if Denmark does not qualify, the result will be **No**.

question.title: Given Denmark qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Denmark has qualified. If Poland does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Denmark secures a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland secure a place as well?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, provided that Denmark has already qualified. If Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the outcome will be N/A.

para_P.title: If Denmark secures a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland secure a place as well?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, provided that Denmark has also secured a spot. If Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the answer will be N/A.

para_P.title: Should Denmark qualify for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having obtained a position in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, contingent upon Denmark also qualifying. If Poland does not qualify, the answer will be **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the answer will be N/A.

question.title: Given Denmark fails to qualify, will Poland qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Denmark takes part in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that Denmark has not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Poland take part in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Denmark does not make it through, can we expect Poland to reach the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive result signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative result indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: If Nvidia's market cap is less than or equal to Apple's on June 28, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to Apple's, as determined by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Given this condition, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: On June 28, 2024, if Nvidia's market capitalization is at most that of Apple's, will Trump's margin over Biden fall between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is at most equal to Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). With this scenario in mind, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive figure reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: On June 28, 2024, if Nvidia's valuation is at or below that of Apple's, will Trump's advantage over Biden range from greater than 2 to 3 or less on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market valuation is at or below Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Under this scenario, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election be between greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: If on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's worth is equal to or less than that of Apple's, will Trump's lead over Biden be between more than 2 and 3 or less on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Given the following conditions: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market worth is equal to or less than Apple's, as confirmed by Companies Market Cap and reviewed by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). In this context, will Donald Trump's edge over Joe Biden in the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 2 but no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, based on the data obtained from Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive figure represents a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Conditional on Deadpool & Wolverine NOT having the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:

This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses $284.5M or less globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does NOT report it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

Suppose the following is true: Deadpool & Wolverine does NOT have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Then, will Disney announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024?

This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats in the aftermath of the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions are equally positioned in terms of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question is based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

The answer to this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media outlets.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

"Accessible" in this context means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU allows them to use it without the need for a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (such as minors), it will still be deemed positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible across the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible across the EU by June 30, 2024, and a **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to specific groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be deemed a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available throughout the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry receives a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) can be accessed across the EU by June 30, 2024, and a **NO** if it cannot.

In this context, "available" means that the typical condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without requiring a VPN (although it may involve a fee). If it is inaccessible in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to particular demographics (such as minors), it will still be regarded as a favorable outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can access it.

The phrase "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be classified as a favorable outcome if the name or website undergoes changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as the service is substantially the same.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. Numerous drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would call for Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals who are knowledgeable about these initiatives.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could happen through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively asking him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step down will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will tend to resolve to NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.body:
As reported by Politico:

Two representatives from secure districts have already publicly urged Biden to withdraw. Furthermore, two of the most at-risk Democrats have indicated to local news agencies that they no longer believe Biden can secure victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the dynamics are even more tumultuous. Multiple drafts of letters are being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would call for Biden to end his campaign, according to five sources who are familiar with the matter.

This market will resolve to YES if a group of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or Senators comes together to encourage Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly advocate for him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could occur through a gathering with Biden where they collectively urge him to withdraw.

This market requires that all five individuals convey a unified message. If five individuals separately communicate to reporters that they believe Biden should resign, that will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats asking Biden to resign will not meet this market's criteria unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market closes. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will tend to resolve NO.

If these conditions are not met before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th. Then, will the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a Manifold poll facing Joe Biden exceed that in a poll facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more? 

There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 and at most 3 in the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as depicted in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 3 according to 538's national polling average?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
