question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, fall between 2 and 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question hinges on the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive value signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative value means Biden is in front. For example, if the data on July 5, 2024, shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this analysis.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend's attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite troubled about the prospects of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively bearing 20 lawmakers' signatures are submitted, this will also suffice to resolve the market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e. appointing his VP as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in the presidential position until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States at the close of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it will be marked as NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) will not lead to a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as a President under the Constitution.)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still profoundly concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

Suppose the following is true: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Switzerland qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if Portugal is officially announced by the EBU as not qualifying for the Grand Final.
- The question resolves as **Yes** if Switzerland is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Portugal does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Switzerland advance?
para_P.body:
Assuming this scenario is accurate: Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Switzerland make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is satisfied if Portugal is officially declared by the EBU as not qualifying for the Grand Final.
- The question is answered with **Yes** if Switzerland is officially declared by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final. If Switzerland does not advance, the answer is **No**.

para_P.title: If Portugal does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Switzerland advance?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Switzerland secure a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is satisfied if Portugal is officially stated by the EBU as not qualifying for the Grand Final.
- The question is answered with **Yes** if Switzerland is officially confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Switzerland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Should Portugal fail to reach the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, can Switzerland qualify?
para_P.body:
Given the following scenario: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not advancing to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Under these circumstances, will Switzerland achieve qualification for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if the EBU officially states that Portugal does not qualify for the Grand Final.
- The answer will be **Yes** if Switzerland is officially recognized by the EBU as qualified for the Grand Final. Conversely, if Switzerland does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose the $57 billion compensation package for Elon Musk or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: The question will be answered with **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors at Tesla. If not, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a communication clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder assembly or against Kimbal Musk's reappointment to the Tesla board of directors. If not, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to reject Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if ISS provides a statement explicitly recommending that Tesla shareholders cast their votes *against* Elon Musk's compensation plan at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or against Kimbal Musk's re-election to the board. If ISS does not provide such a recommendation, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from office prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning from his current presidential term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning, thereby not fulfilling his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that date. A declaration of his plans to do so is adequate for this market to resolve positively.

If this does not happen, the market will resolve as NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce his decision to withdraw from the election and resign from the presidency before the end of July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if Joe Biden issues a statement indicating that he is ending his re-election campaign and intends to step down, thus not completing his current term as president. Such a statement must be made before the close of July 2024, following Pacific Time, although he does not need to have formally resigned and left his position by that time. A declaration of his intention to do so is sufficient for this market to resolve in the affirmative.

If this does not take place, the market will conclude as NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court make any arrest warrants for the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. If not, it will be deemed **No**.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

In this hypothetical situation: If the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not release an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff) before July 1, 2024, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to execute the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will face removal or be barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the removal or barring must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.body: Given that by June 30, 2024, Anthropic releases a *public* document outlining the results from an *external* organization that has assessed the safety of one of their AI models, will Meta also produce a *public* document with the results from an *external* evaluator regarding the safety of one of their AI models by that same date?

question.title: Given Anthropic does not publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Meta publish such a report by then?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Anthropic does not release a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models by June 30, 2024. In this context, we ask whether Meta will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models by the same date.

Resolution criteria:
- For Anthropic: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.
- For Meta: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.

para_P.title: If Anthropic fails to issue a report containing external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Meta release such a report by that date?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Anthropic does not make available a public report detailing the findings from an external entity that red-teamed the safety of their AI models by June 30, 2024. In this light, we question whether Meta will provide a public report with the findings from an external party that red-teamed the safety of their AI models by the same deadline.

Resolution criteria:
- For Anthropic: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Anthropic has not published a public report with findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.
- For Meta: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Meta has published a public report with the findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.

para_P.title: If Anthropic fails to issue a report containing external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Meta issue such a report by that date?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Anthropic does not provide a public report featuring findings from an external assessment of their AI models' safety by June 30, 2024. In this light, we seek to determine whether Meta will release a public report that includes results from an external evaluation of the safety of their AI models by the same deadline.

Resolution criteria:
- For Anthropic: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a public report with findings from an external assessment of their AI models' safety.
- For Meta: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the findings from an external evaluation of the safety of their AI models.

para_P.title: Should Anthropic not release a report detailing the results of an external red-teaming assessment by June 30, 2024, will Meta provide such a report by that same date?
para_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Anthropic does not issue a public report that includes the findings from an external review of the safety of their AI models by June 30, 2024. In this context, we aim to find out if Meta will publish a public report that contains results from an external evaluation of the safety of their AI models by the same deadline.

Resolution criteria:
- For Anthropic: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Anthropic fails to release a public report with findings from an external review of their AI models' safety.
- For Meta: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Meta releases a public report with the findings from an external assessment of the safety of their AI models.
